title: Birth of the Great Leader Mustafa Kemal ATATÜRK.

images.alt: A photograph of his father, Ali Rıza Efendi, taken while he was an officer in the Asakir-i Milliye Battalion following the 1877–1878 Ottoman-Russian War.

title: Starting primary education.
description: (He attended the local primary school for a short period, then transferred to Şemsi Efendi School, which provided modern education, and completed his primary education there.)

title: Death of his father Ali Rıza Efendi.
Enrollment in the Thessaloniki Military Middle School.
description: (After Şemsi Efendi Primary School, he attended Thessaloniki Civil Middle School for a while, but left this school after a mathematics teacher named Kaymak Hafız unjustly beat him with a stick. He then applied to the Military Middle School on his own initiative and decision, and continued his education there.)

title: Enrollment in the Manastır Military High School.
Enrollment in the Military Academy in Istanbul.
Enrollment in the Army War College with the rank of Second Lieutenant.
Advancing to the second year of the Army War College and promotion to First Lieutenant.
Graduation from the Army War College with the rank of Captain and assignment to the 5th Army command.
Founding of the secret Vatan ve Hürriyet (Fatherland and Freedom) Society with some friends in Damascus.
Award of the Fifth Class Order of the Medjidie for distinguished service in the Syrian region.

images.alt: Captain Mustafa Kemal with his friends, Beirut, 1906.
With his friends Halil and Müfit Bey, Beirut, 1906

title: Promotion to Senior Captain

images.alt: Senior Captain Mustafa Kemal, Damascus, June 1907.

title: Assignment from Damascus to the 3rd Army Headquarters located in Manastır.
description: (He served at this headquarters' branch in Thessaloniki.)

title: Publication of his translation of General Litzmann's book 'Team Combat Training' - related to military education- in Thessaloniki.
Assignment to the Eastern Railway Inspectorate in addition to his duties at the 3rd Army Headquarters.
The Proclamation of the Second Constitutional Monarchy.
Convening of the Parliament in Istanbul after the proclamation of the Second Constitutional Monarchy.
Appointment as Chief of Staff of the 3rd Army Thessaloniki 2nd Reserve Division.
The outbreak of a major uprising in Istanbul against the Second Constitutional Monarchy - triggered by the uprising of rifle battalions (31 March Incident).
Movement with the Action Army from Thessaloniki to Istanbul - as Chief of Staff of this army.

images.alt: Before setting off for Istanbul with the Action Army, Thessaloniki, 1909.
As Chief of Staff of the Action Army, before his departure from Thessaloniki to Istanbul, Thessaloniki, 15–16 April 1909
With Hüseyin Hüsnü Pasha, Commander of the Action Army, Thessaloniki

title: Return from Istanbul to Thessaloniki.
Participation in the military maneuvers at Cumalı Camp.
Convening of the 'Committee of Union and Progress Grand Congress' in Thessaloniki.
description: (Mustafa Kemal delivered a speech at this congress, arguing that the army should stay out of politics.)

title: Reassignment from Chief of Staff of Thessaloniki 2nd Reserve Division to the 3rd Army Headquarters.
Publication of his book titled 'Cumalı Camp' in Thessaloniki.
description: (This small book consists of notes and sketches taken during the military manoeuvre held at Cumalı Ordugâhı between 30 August and 8 September 1909.)

title: Appointment as Commander of the Third Army Officer Training Centre.
Dispatch to France to observe the Picardie Maneuvers as a representative of the army.
Reassignment from Third Army Officer Training Centre Command back to Third Army Headquarters.
Assignment to the 38th Infantry Regiment located in Thessaloniki.
Participation in the maneuvers conducted by the 5th Corps between Thessaloniki and Kilkis.
description: (Manevra, 20 Nisan 1911 akşamı sona ermiştir.)

title: Assignment to the 1st Department of the Ottoman General Staff in Istanbul.
Italian declaration of war against the Ottoman Empire in Tripolitania.
Secret departure from Istanbul with his friends to volunteer in Tripolitania.

images.alt: With the Hilal-i Ahmer (Red Crescent) delegation, Tripolitania, 1912.

title: Promotion to Major.
Appointment as Commander of the Tobruk Region, replacing Ethem Pasha
His arrival in Derne and his assumption of command of the Derne Eastern Wing.
Publication of his book titled Tâbiye Tatbikat Seyahatı (Tactics Exercise Journey) in Thessaloniki.
description: (This small book consists of notes and sketches from a military exercise conducted by the 5th Corps on 19-20 April 1911, in which he himself participated.)

title: Appointment as Commander of Derna.
Departure from Derna to Istanbul.
Beginning of the Balkan War.
Appointment as Commander of the Bahr-i Sefîd (Dardanelles) Strait Organized Forces in Gallipoli.
Fall of Edirne to the Bulgarians.
Signing of the Treaty of London between the Ottoman Empire and the Balkan states.
description: (With this agreement, the Ottoman Empire accepted the Midye-Enez line as its border and ceded Edirne to Bulgaria.)

title: The recapture of Edirne from the Bulgarians.
Signing of the Treaty of Istanbul between the Ottoman Empire and Bulgaria at the end of the Balkan War.
Appointment as Military Attaché to Sofia.
Arrival in Sofia and beginning of his military attaché duties.
Assignment to also serve as Military Attaché to Bucharest, Belgrade, and Cetinje in addition to Sofia.
Promotion to Lieutenant Colonel.

images.alt: Lieutenant Colonel Mustafa Kemal with his friends, Sofia, Bulgaria, 1914.
Lieutenant Colonel Mustafa Kemal, at a ball in Sofia wearing a Janissary costume, Bulgaria, Sofia, 11–12 May 1914.

title: Beginning of World War I.
Appointment to the Command of the 19th Division to be established in Tekirdağ under the 3rd Corps.
His arrival in Tekirdağ and the commencement of efforts to establish the 19th Division.
Transfer of the 19th Division Command from Tekirdağ to Maydos (Eceabat) and continuation of his duties as Commander of the Maydos Region while commanding the 19th Division.
Failure of the British and French fleets attempting to pass through the Dardanelles Strait, suffering heavy losses in the process.
Decision to establish the 5th Army in Gallipoli following the growing importance of the Dardanelles front, and appointment of German General Marshal Liman von Sanders as its commander.
description: (Liman von Sanders arrived at Gallipoli on 26 March 1915 to take command.)

title: Deployment of the 19th Division under his command to Bigalı to form the general reserve of the 5th Army.

images.alt: Lieutenant Colonel Mustafa Kemal at the front, Gallipoli, Dardanelles, May 2, 1915.

title: Beginning of the British landing operations at Dardanelles together with French forces and the ANZAC Corps from the shores of Arıburnu, Seddülbahir, and Kumkale; These forces were forced to retreat by the attack of the 19th Division forces under Mustafa Kemal's command, which had advanced from Bigalı.
Award of medal.
description: The Silver Imtiyaz Medal (Medal of Merit) awarded to ATATÜRK by Sultan Mehmet V Reşat while he was the Commander of the 19th Division. On the front side is the imperial coat of arms of Sultan Abdülhamit II, and on the back is the inscription 'This medal is reserved for those who demonstrate extraordinary loyalty and bravery for the Ottoman Empire' and the date 1300. On the green and red ribbon, there is a plaque over crossed swords. The year 1332 (1916) is written in old script on the plaque on the ribbon.

title: Promotion to Colonel.

images.alt: Colonel Mustafa Kemal, Gallipoli, Dardanelles, June 17, 1915.

title: Award of The War Medal.

images.alt: With a delegation of journalists, writers and poets from Istanbul, Gallipoli, Çanakkale, 16 July 1915.

title: Appointment as Commander of the Anafartalar Group by order of 5th Army Commander General Liman von Sanders.
Attack by forces under his command against the British in the Anafartalar region; pushing the enemy back to the shores from which they had launched their assault from the hills.

The forces under his command launched a successful attack on the British at Conkbayırı (Chunuk Bair). (During this battle, he narrowly escaped certain death when a piece of shrapnel aimed at his heart ricocheted off his pocket watch in his breast pocket.)
Award of the 'Silver Medal of Merit for Combat' due to outstanding achievements in the Anafartalar Group Command.
British evacuation of occupied trenches and secret nighttime withdrawal from the Anafartalar - Arıburnu region.
Award of the 'Golden Medal of Merit for Combat' due to outstanding achievements during the 'Anafartalar Group Command' period.
Appointment to the Command of the 16th Corps, headquartered in Edirne.
The decision by the Commander-in-Chief's Office to relocate the headquarters of the 16th Corps under his command to Diyarbakır.
Arrival in Istanbul from Edirne following the decision to transfer the 16th Corps headquarters from Edirne to Diyarbakır.
Departure from Istanbul to take up his assignment in Diyarbakır.
Arrival in Diyarbakır and assumption of command of the 16th Corps.
Promotion to Major General.
Transfer of the headquarters of the 16th Corps under his command from Diyarbakır to Silvan.
Departure from Diyarbakır to Silvan.
Launch of offensive operations by forces under his command toward Bitlis and Muş.
Liberation of Muş from enemy occupation by forces under his command.
Liberation of Bitlis from enemy occupation by forces under his command.

images.alt: Commander of the 16th Corps, Mustafa Kemal Pasha, Bitlis, 16 November 1916.

title: Appointment as Deputy Commander of the 2nd Army following Ahmet İzzet Pasha's departure to Istanbul on leave. Award of the 'Second Class Order of the Medjidie' to Mustafa Kemal ATATÜRK for his successes on the Muş and Bitlis fronts.
Arrival at the 2nd Army Headquarters in Sekerat (a district center under Palu county of Diyarbakır) and assumption of deputy commander duties.
Appointment as Commander of the Hejaz Expeditionary Force.
Departure from Diyarbakır to go to Damascus.
Arrival in Damascus.
Appointment as Commander of the 2nd Army following the dissolution of the Hejaz Expeditionary Force Command.
Return from Damascus to Diyarbakır as Commander of the 2nd Army.

images.alt: Commander of the 2nd Army, Mustafa Kemal Pasha, Diyarbakır, March 1917.

title: Appointment as Commander of the 7th Army under the Yıldırım (Lightning/Blitz) Army Group Command.

images.alt: While inspecting the Austro-Hungarian automobile unit, Diyarbakır, 1917.

title: Departure from Diyarbakır to Istanbul after being summoned by Enver Pasha to establish the 7th Army headquarters.
Arrival in Istanbul from Diyarbakır.
Departure from Istanbul to Aleppo to begin duties as 7th Army Commander. (The 7th Army headquarters was located in the Aziziye district of Aleppo.)
His comprehensive report from Aleppo to the Minister of Navy and 4th Army Commander Cemal Pasha -who was in Istanbul- conveying his thoughts and recommendations regarding the Sinai Front.
Resignation from 7th Army Command as a result of disagreement with Yıldırım Army Group Commander Marshal Falkenhayn.
Reappointment to command of the 2nd Army located in Diyarbakır.
description: (Since Mustafa Kemal did not accept this appointment, the process did not take effect, and he came to Istanbul from Aleppo, considered on leave in his capacity as 2nd Army Commander.)

images.alt: Commander of the 7th Army, Mustafa Kemal Pasha, with his aides Salih (BOZOK), Şükrü (TEZER) and Cevat Abbas (GÜRER), Aleppo, 15 October 1917.

title: Return to Istanbul from Aleppo. (In some sources, his return to Istanbul is shown as mid-October or late October.)
Assignment to the General Headquarters in Istanbul.
Departure from Istanbul to accompany Crown Prince Vahdettin Efendi to Germany.
Award of the 'Order of Medjidie with Combatants Crossed Sabers, 1st Class' for outstanding achievements up to that date.
Return to Istanbul from the Germany trip.
Award of the '1st Class Order of the Crown with swords - Kingdom of Prussia' by the German Emperor.
Travelling from Istanbul to Vienna for treatment due to kidney disease.
description: (He received treatment in Vienna and Karlsbad for about 2 months.)

title: Return from Vienna to Istanbul. (This date is shown as August 4, 1918 in some sources.)
Reappointment as commander of the 7th Army under Marshal Liman von Sanders, who had been appointed to command the Yıldırım Army Group in place of Marshal Falkenhayn.
Arrival at the 7th Army headquarters in Nablus and assumption of command.
Beginning of general offensive by British forces on the Palestine Front.
Decision to move the 7th Army to the east of the Jordan River in face of the advancing British offensive.
description: (Following the breach of the 8th Army front against the British offensive of September 19, the 4th and 7th Armies were also in danger of being encircled by the enemy. In this situation, Mustafa Kemal Atatürk gave the order to his troops on September 20 to withdraw to the east of the Jordan River in order to continue fighting under favourable conditions. Upon this decision, the 7th Army units withdrew to Rayak and then to Aleppo without breaking their organization and fighting strength.)

title: Award of the honorary title of aide-de-camp for extraordinary services and saving his army from annihilation.
description: (This date is given as September 21 in some sources and September 23 in others.)

title: British entry into Aleppo. 7th Army units under Mustafa Kemal's command stopping British attacks north of Aleppo and preventing the enemy from crossing this line.
Signing of the Armistice of Mudros between the Ottoman Empire and the Allied Powers.
Marshal Liman von Sanders transferring the commmand of the Yıldırım Army Group to Mustafa Kemal ATATÜRK.

images.alt: Mustafa Kemal Pasha with Marshal Liman von Sanders from whom he took over the command of the Yıldırım Army Group

title: Dissolution of the Yıldırım Army Group Command and 7th Army headquarters and assignment to the Ministry of War.
Departure by train from Adana to Istanbul.
Arrival in Istanbul from Adana.
Publication in Istanbul of his work titled 'Officer and Commander' which he wrote in 1914.
Appointment as Inspector of the 9th Army Units.
Greek landing in İzmir.
Departure from Istanbul on the Bandırma Ferry (SS Bandırma) to cross to Anatolia.
His landing in Samsun.
His report from Samsun to the Grand Vizierate: The nation has united and adopted the principle of sovereignty and Turkish identity as its goal.
Movement from Samsun to Havza.
Movement from Havza to Amasya.
Sending letters from Amasya to some prominent figures in Istanbul, inviting them to the National Struggle.
His circular from Amasya to civil and military authorities in Anatolia.
description: 'The integrity of the homeland and the independence of the nation are in danger. The determination and decision of the nation will save the independence of the nation. ...'

title: His arrival in Erzurum, where he was greeted with displays of affection by the people and the soldiers.
His telegram to the Ministry of War and the Sultan announcing his resignation from both his official duties and military profession.
His circular to the army, provinces, and the nation announcing his resignation from both his official duties and military profession.
description: 'From now on, I declare and announce that I am present among the nation as an individual fighter, ready to work with all kinds of sacrifice for our sacred national goal.'

title: Public announcement in the Albayrak Newspaper published in Erzurum of his resignation from the military and assumption of leadership of the Erzurum branch of the Association for the Defence of National Rights for the Eastern Provinces.
description: '... His Excellency Mustafa Kemal Pasha's resignation letter is a document of determination and faith. It is magnificent evidence showing that the old blood has not yet been extinguished in the nation. Seeing this respected commander, who elevated and exalted national honor at Anafartalar and the sacred duty that history expects from today's generation, at the head of the National Struggle today is a blessed sight.'

title: The opening of the Erzurum Congress and the election of Mustafa Kemal as President of the Congress..
Conclusion of the Erzurum Congress with a brief speech by Mustafa Kemal.
description: 'At the most exciting time when our nation was struggling with hope for salvation, your devoted and respected assembly gathered here in Erzurum, enduring all kinds of hardships. With a sensitive and noble spirit and very strong faith, it made fundamental decisions regarding the salvation of our homeland and nation. Especially, it showed the existence and unity of our nation to the whole world. History will undoubtedly record this congress of ours as a rare and great work.' Election of Mustafa Kemal to the Presidency of the Representative Committee by the Erzurum Congress.

title: Issuance of an imperial decree regarding Mustafa Kemal's dismissal from the military profession, withdrawal of his medals and orders, and revocation of his honorary aide-de-camp title.
Mustafa Kemal's arrival in Sivas, being welcomed with heartfelt demonstrations.
Opening of the Sivas Congress and election of Mustafa Kemal as President of the Sivas Congress.

images.alt: With the Commander of the 5th Caucasian Division, Cemil Cahit (TOYDEMİR) Bey

title: Conclusion of the Sivas Congress. Submission to Sivas province of the document signed by Mustafa Kemal regarding the establishment of 'The Association for the Defense of Rights in Anatolia and Rumelia'.

images.alt: With the members of the Sivas Congress

title: Declaration to the nation on behalf of the Representative Committee.
description: 'There is no doubt that our nation, which has not deviated even slightly from its national dignity and the qualities inherited from its past of respecting everyone's rights even under the most severe historical conditions, will remain steadfast in the same manner and behavior from now on, and will thus have its civilization capacity to possess these blessed lands acknowledged by the whole world.'

images.alt: With Bekir Sami (KUNDUH) Bey and Rauf (ORBAY) Bey
With Bekir Sami (KUNDUH) Bey and Rauf (ORBAY) Bey

title: Movement from Sivas to Amasya.
Beginning of negotiations in Amasya with the Istanbul Government's Naval Minister Salih Pasha, accompanied by Rauf and Bekir Sami Beys (Amasya Interview).
Conclusion of the Amasya Negotiations (Amasya Interview).
His election as deputy for Erzurum in the elections held for the Ottoman Parliament, which was decided to reconvene in Istanbul.
His arrival in Ankara and reception with grand ceremony.
description: (After entering the city, Mustafa Kemal rested and had tea in the governor's office for a while, then visited the 20th Corps, and from there came to the Agricultural School allocated to him and his friends.) Mustafa Kemal's telegram to all organizations announcing 'his arrival in Ankara and that Ankara is the center of the Representative Committee.'

title: Opening of the last 'Ottoman Parliament' in Istanbul.
description: (Upon the occupation of Istanbul, the Parliament held its last meeting on March 18, 1920, deciding to suspend its activities, and was closed by imperial decree on April 11, 1920.)

title: Adoption of the National Pact in the secret meeting of the Ottoman Parliament.

quotes.text: At the Erzurum and Sivas congresses, it was necessary to establish a modern national border; I chose the border indicated by the Turkish bayonets.

title: Decision in the Ottoman Parliament to notify foreign parliaments and press of the National Pact.
Official occupation of Istanbul by the Allied Powers, which had been under de facto occupation since November 13, 1918. Mustafa Kemal's declaration to the nation due to the occupation of Istanbul.
description: '... Today, by forcibly occupying Istanbul, the seven hundred years of life and sovereignty of the Ottoman Empire was ended. That is, today the Turkish nation was called to defend its civilized capacity, its right to live and independence, and its entire future.'

title: His circular to provinces, sub-governorships, and corps commanders for urgent elections to convene a parliament in Ankara.
description: 'A parliament with extraordinary powers will convene in Ankara to govern and supervise national affairs!'

title: Opening of the Turkish Grand National Assembly in Ankara.

images.alt: Opening of the Turkish Grand National Assembly
Opening of the Turkish Grand National Assembly

title: Election of Mustafa Kemal as President of the Turkish Grand National Assembly and his acceptance speech.

quotes.text: ...Throughout all periods of my military and political life, my guiding principle in all my struggles has always been to act in accordance with the national will, striving towards the goals that the nation and the homeland require...

title: Mustafa Kemal's sentencing to death by the military court in Istanbul.
The ratification by Sultan Vahdettin of the execution order concerning Mustafa Kemal, on 11 May 1920
The Greeks launching a general offensive from the Milne Line.
Mustafa Kemal's speech in the Turkish Grand National Assembly.

quotes.text: ...Even if not just one-fiftieth of our homeland but the whole of it were destroyed, even if the whole of it were left in flames, we would climb a hill on this land and from there we would engage in defence!...

title: Signing of the 'Treaty of Sèvres' between the Istanbul Government and the Allied Powers.
Mustafa Kemal's publication of a brochure under the title 'Populism Program', its presentation to the Turkish Grand National Assembly and distribution to members.
Signing of the Treaty of Gümrü with the Armenians.

Mustafa Kemal's arrival in Bilecik, his meeting there with the Istanbul delegation headed by Interior Minister Ahmet İzzet Pasha, and his announcement that he would not allow the delegation to return to Istanbul but would go to Ankara together (Bilecik Interview).
First Battle of İnönü Victory.
Mustafa Kemal's congratulatory telegram to Western Front Commander İsmet (İnönü) Bey on the occasion of the First İnönü Victory:

quotes.text: ...I pray to Allah that this success may be a auspicious beginning to the definitive victory that will completely liberate our sacred lands from enemy occupation, and I request that this celebration be conveyed to all the soldiers and officers of the Western Army.

title: Adoption of the first Fundamental Law (The 1921 Constitution) by the Turkish Grand National Assembly.
Mustafa Kemal's opening speech for the second session of the first term of the Turkish Grand National Assembly:

quotes.text: ...It has now been understood that the provisions of the Treaty of Sèvres cannot be forcibly imposed on Turkey....

title: Signing of the Moscow Treaty between the Government of the Turkish Grand National Assembly and Soviet Russia.
Second Battle of İnönü Victory. Mustafa Kemal's reply telegram to Western Front Commander İsmet Pasha:

quotes.text: ...You defeated not only the enemy there, but also the nation's misfortune. Along with our unfortunate lands under occupation, the entire homeland is celebrating your victory today, even in its remotest corners. The enemy's lust for conquest was shattered against the sheer cliffs of your determination and loyalty.

title: Establishment of the 'Defense of Rights in Anatolia and Rumelia Group' in the Turkish Grand National Assembly.
Mustafa Kemal's election as group chairman at the 'Defense of Rights in Anatolia and Rumelia Group's' general assembly meeting.
Mustafa Kemal's opening speech at the Education Congress convened in Ankara, which continued its work until July 21, 1921:

quotes.text: ...While raising our children and young people, it is essential to instil in them the necessity of combating all foreign elements that conflict with their very existence, their rights, and their unity, and to impress upon them the need to defend national ideas with complete conviction, fiercely and selflessly against any opposing view.

title: Mustafa Kemal's arrival from Ankara to the Western Front Headquarters in Karacahisar. Mustafa Kemal's directive to İsmet Pasha at the Western Front Headquarters:
description: After gathering the army north and south of Eskişehir, it is necessary to put a great distance between our army and the enemy army so that the reorganization and reinforcement of the army can be possible. For this purpose, it is appropriate to withdraw as far as the east of Sakarya.

title: Withdrawal of the Turkish army to the east of the Sakarya River on the Western Front.

Adoption of the Law granting Mustafa Kemal the authority of Commander-in-Chief with broad powers for three months in the Grand National Assembly. Mustafa Kemal's speech in the Turkish Grand National Assembly after becoming the commander-in-chief:

quotes.text: ...My confidence and trust that, with Allah's help, we will defeat the enemies who seek to enslave our nation has never wavered for a single moment. At this moment, I declare this firm conviction before your distinguished assembly, before the entire nation, and before the whole world.

title: Mustafa Kemal's issuance of the National Obligations Orders.
Greek army's attack and the beginning of the Battle of Sakarya.
description: (It lasted for 22 days and 22 nights.)

title: Commander-in-Chief Mustafa Kemal's order to the troops:

quotes.text: There is no defense line, but defense territory. That territory is the entire homeland. Not a single inch of the homeland can be abandoned until it is soaked with the blood of its citizens!

title: Victory in the Battle of Sakarya.
The Turkish Grand National Assembly grants the rank of “marshal” and the title of “gazi” upon Mustafa Kemal by law.
Signing of the Treaty of Kars between the Government of the Turkish Grand National Assembly and the Caucasian Republics (Azerbaijan, Georgia, Armenia).
Signing of the Ankara Agreement between the Government of the Turkish Grand National Assembly and the French Government.
Adoption of the Law extending Mustafa Kemal's term as Commander-in-Chief for another 3 months starting from November 5, 1921, in the Turkish Grand National Assembly.
Extension of Mustafa Kemal's term as Commander-in-Chief for three months.

Establishment of the 'War Committee' under the chairmanship of Mustafa Kemal, consisting of the Second President of the Assembly, Ministers of Finance and National Defense, the Chief of General Staff, and the chairmen of the National Defense and Finance Committees.
Adoption of the Law extending Mustafa Kemal's term as Commander-in-Chief for the second time for three months starting from February 5, 1922, in the Turkish Grand National Assembly.
Mustafa Kemal's opening speech for the third meeting year of the first period of the Turkish Grand National Assembly:
description: ... Gentlemen! The Grand National Assembly Government is working to ensure the continuity and independence of Turkey and the Turkish people. Because the definite desire and will of the Turkish people, who are the true, legitimate and real owners of Turkey, is in this direction...

quotes.text: Agriculture is the foundation of the national economy. The true owner and master of the country is the peasant, the real producer.

title: Adoption of the Law extending Mustafa Kemal's term as Commander-in-Chief for the third time for three months in the Turkish Grand National Assembly.
Adoption in the Turkish Grand National Assembly of Mustafa Kemal remaining as Commander-in-Chief indefinitely.
Beginning of the Great Offensive.
Victory in the Battle of Dumlupınar (Commander-in-Chief) by completely surrounding and annihilating the Greek army.
Mustafa Kemal's declaration to the army:
description: ... I want all my friends to advance considering that other pitched battles will be fought in Anatolia, and for everyone to continue to competitively display their mental powers and sources of heroism and patriotism. Armies! Your first target is the Mediterranean, forward!

title: Mustafa Kemal's message to the armies upon the news of the capture of İzmir:
description: I remember with respect and appreciation the effort and sacrifice shown by the armies in reaching the first Mediterranean target I gave. I have complete confidence that the armies will show the same desire and sacrifice in achieving the targets to be given from now on.

title: Mustafa Kemal's arrival in İzmir.
Mustafa Kemal's speech in the Turkish Grand National Assembly about the August 26 Offensive, August 30 and September 9 Victories:
description: ... This Anatolian Victory will remain among the pages of history as the most beautiful example of how powerful and vigorous a force an idea completely adopted by a nation can be.

title: Signing of the Armistice of Mudanya.
Decision to separate the Caliphate and Sultanate from each other and abolish the Sultanate.
Death of Mustafa Kemal's mother Zübeyde Hanım in İzmir.
Mustafa Kemal's visit to İzmir to visit his mother's grave.
Mustafa Kemal's marriage to Latife (Uşaklıgil) Hanım in İzmir.
Mustafa Kemal's opening speech at the Turkish Economy Congress convened in İzmir:
description: ... No matter how great political and military victories may be, if they are not crowned with economic victories, the resulting victories cannot be permanent and will fade away in a short time...

title: Mustafa Kemal's opening speech for the fourth meeting year of the first period of the Turkish Grand National Assembly:
description: ... It is known that the policy we follow is a peaceful policy. The attempt to trample and have our country trampled without any basis in right and justice has been met with the failure it deserved through the self-sacrificing efforts of our victorious army, and our nation has saved our beloved homeland by achieving a victory rarely recorded in history...

title: Mustafa Kemal's declaration to the nation containing 9 principles as President of the Association for the Defense of Rights in Anatolia and Rumelia on the occasion of parliamentary elections.
Signing of the Treaty of Lausanne.

Mustafa Kemal's second election as President of the Turkish Grand National Assembly. Mustafa Kemal's opening speech for the first meeting year of the second period of the Turkish Grand National Assembly:
description: ... We will make our country prosperous, our people happy and bring them to prosperity. Our hope, our decision and especially the unity and solidarity that our nation and your High Assembly will show will surely be the guarantee of success in our work on the path of progress and civilization...

title: Establishment of the People's Party and Mustafa Kemal's election as General Chairman of the People's Party.
Ankara becoming the capital.

quotes.text: Gentlemen! We shall declare the republic tomorrow!

title: Proclamation of the Republic and Mustafa Kemal's election as President.
Appointment of İsmet Pasha by Mustafa Kemal to form the cabinet.
Awarding of the Medal of Independence War with green-red ribbon to Mustafa Kemal by decision of the Turkish Grand National Assembly.
Mustafa Kemal's opening speech for the first meeting year of the second period of the Turkish Grand National Assembly:
description: ... We see the need to remove Islam from its position as a political tool, as has been customary for centuries, and to elevate it. It is imperative, for the sake of the nation's happiness in this world and the next, to rescue our sacred and divine beliefs and moral values from politics and all its aspects, which are dark and uncertain and a stage for all kinds of interests and passions to emerge. Only in this way will the greatness of Islam be revealed.

title: Adoption of the Tevhid-i Tedrisat (Unification of Education) Law. Adoption of the Law on the abolition of the Caliphate and the removal of the Ottoman dynasty from the borders of the Republic of Turkey. Adoption of the Law on the abolition of the Ministry of Religious Affairs and Foundations (Şeriye ve Evkaf Vekâleti) and the Ministry of General Staff (Erkân-ı Harbiye-i Umumiye Vekâleti).
description: (The Presidency of Religious Affairs was established to carry out the religious services of the Ministry of Religious Affairs and Foundations, and the General Staff was established in place of the Ministry of General Staff.)

title: Establishment of Türkiye İş Bankası (İş Bank of Turkey) in Ankara under Mustafa Kemal's directive.
Mustafa Kemal laying the foundation stone of the Unknown Soldier Monument in Dumlupınar.
President Mustafa Kemal's opening speech for the second meeting year of the second period of the Turkish Grand National Assembly:
description: ... There should be no doubt that a new and prosperous Ankara, rapidly created in the middle of Anatolia, will be a center of civilization in its own right for the Turkish homeland that has been neglected for centuries, and a very important support for the Turkish state!...

title: Establishment of the Progressive Republican Party. (It was dissolved by decision of the Council of Ministers at the beginning of June 1925.)
Adoption of the Law on the abolition of the Tithe (Aşar).
Adoption of the Law on the Maintenance of Order (Takrir-i Sükûn) in the Turkish Grand National Assembly.
Mustafa Kemal's separation from Latife (Uşaklıgil) Hanım.
Mustafa Kemal's arrival at the Turkish Hearth in İnebolu with a panama hat in his hand and making a speech about clothing and hats.
President Mustafa Kemal's opening speech for the third meeting year of the second period of the Turkish Grand National Assembly:
description: ... Only the Republic itself raises the press equipped with its own mentality and morality of the Republican era...

title: Mustafa Kemal's speech at the opening ceremony of Ankara Law School:
description: I have never felt the happiness I felt at the opening of this great institution that will be the strength and support of the Republic in any enterprise, and I am pleased to show and express this.

title: Adoption of the Hat Law.
Adoption of the Law on the closure of dervish lodges and shrines and the abolition of tomb keeperships and certain titles.
Adoption of Laws on international time and calendar.
Adoption of the Turkish Civil Code.
Adoption of the Law of Obligations.
Adoption of the Turkish Commercial Code.
Arrest of the ringleaders of the planned assassination attempt against Mustafa Kemal in İzmir.
Mustafa Kemal's statement to Anadolu Agency about the İzmir assassination attempt:
description: ... There is no doubt that the vile attempt was directed rather at our sacred Republic and the high principles on which it is based than at my person. My humble body will surely become soil one day; but the Republic of Turkey will live forever!

title: Mustafa Kemal's opening speech for the fourth assembly year of the second period of the Turkish Grand National Assembly:
description: ... This great nation has always appreciated and protected its children who try to see and can see the directions towards which their desires and talents are oriented...

title: Issuing of a decree regarding Mustafa Kemal's retirement from military service upon his petition.
Mustafa Kemal's first arrival in İstanbul after the Liberation and his enthusiastic reception.
Convening of the 'Second Great Congress' of the Republican People's Party in Ankara and Mustafa Kemal's beginning to read the Great Speech (Nutuk) that lasted 36 hours and 33 minutes.
Mustafa Kemal's completion of the Great Speech he delivered at the Second Great Congress of the Republican People's Party:
description: ... The outcome we have achieved today is the result of the vigilance born of centuries of national calamities and the blood shed in every corner of this sacred homeland. I entrust this outcome to the Turkish youth. O Turkish Youth! Your first duty is to preserve and defend Turkish independence and the Turkish Republic forever. ... You will find the strength you need in your noble blood.!

title: Mustafa Kemal's second election as President. Mustafa Kemal's opening speech for the first assembly year of the third period of the Turkish Grand National Assembly:
description: ... The Grand National Assembly is the essence of the Turkish nation's centuries-long searches and the living symbol of its consciousness to govern itself. Since the day the Turkish nation entrusted its destiny to the capable and patriotic hands of the Grand National Assembly, it has stripped away the darkness and produced suns and victories that dazzled the nation's eyes from disasters that stifled hopes...

title: Making important Constitutional amendments regarding secularism.
Adoption of the Law on the use of international numerals.
Mustafa Kemal's speech about the new letters in İstanbul Sarayburnu Park:
description: ... Our harmonious, rich language will reveal itself through the new Turkish alphabet. We must free ourselves from the incomprehensible and ununderstandable symbols that have confined our minds within an iron frame for centuries, and we must understand this necessity!...

title: Adoption of the Law on the adoption and implementation of the new Turkish letters. President Mustafa Kemal's opening speech for the second meeting year of the third period of the Turkish Grand National Assembly:
description: ... The Turkish letters gaining certainty and legality by the decision of the Grand National Assembly will be a victory in itself in this country's struggle for advancement...

title: Mustafa Kemal's acceptance of the General Presidency and Head Teachership of the Nation's Schools that would become active to teach the new script to the people.
Opening of Nation's Schools to teach the new letters and writing with these letters to the people.
Mustafa Kemal's opening speech for the third meeting year of the third period of the Turkish Grand National Assembly:
description: ... Turkish letters, which are the greatest work of our Assembly, have been completely applied to the general life of the country. The initial difficulties have been easily overcome thanks to the nation's ideal strength and love for civilization...

title: Adoption of the new Municipal Law granting Turkish women the right to vote and be elected in municipal elections.
Establishment of the Liberal Republican Party. (The party dissolved itself on November 17, 1930.)
Mustafa Kemal's opening speech for the fourth meeting year of the third period of the Turkish Grand National Assembly:
description: ... One of the important events of last year was the arrival of the railway to Sivas. I am confident that this work, which helps to expand and strengthen the homeland even more despite so many difficulties, will be remembered with gratitude by the Turkish nation in the future!...

title: The martyrdom of Kubilay, a reserve officer teacher, in Menemen.
Establishment of the Turkish Historical Research Society under Mustafa Kemal's directive. (It later took the name 'Turkish Historical Society'.)
Mustafa Kemal's third election as President.
Mustafa Kemal's opening speech at the Third Great Congress of the Republican People's Party convened in Ankara:
description: ... If the memory of works done for the nation and by the nation is not held above all kinds of memories, it is impossible to appreciate the value of the concept of national history!

title: Mustafa Kemal's opening speech for the first meeting year of the fourth period of the Turkish Grand National Assembly:
description: ... A peace direction that aims for Turkey's security and is not against any nation will always be our rule.

title: Opening of the People's Houses.
Establishment of the 'Turkish Language Research Society' under Mustafa Kemal's directive. (It later took the name 'Turkish Language Institution'.)
Mustafa Kemal's opening speech for the second meeting year of the fourth period of the Turkish Grand National Assembly:
description: ... We will ensure the advancement of national culture in every field as the fundamental wish of the Republic of Turkey!...

title: Adoption of the Law on the closure of İstanbul Darülfünun and the establishment of a new university by the Ministry of National Education.
Establishment of İstanbul University to replace İstanbul Darülfünun which was closed by law.
Mustafa Kemal's famous speech to the Turkish nation on the occasion of the 10th Anniversary of the Republic:
description: ... We have accomplished many great things in a short time. The greatest of these works is the Republic of Turkey, whose foundation is Turkish heroism and high Turkish culture. ... I have no doubt that the forgotten great civilized character and great civilized capability of Turkishness will rise like a new sun from the high civilization horizon of the future with its future development. ... How happy is the one who says I am a Turk!

sounds.alt: Tenth Anniversary Speech in Atatürk's voice

title: Mustafa Kemal's opening speech for the third meeting year of the fourth period of the Turkish Grand National Assembly:
description: ... The past ten years is nothing but a beginning for future periods. Nevertheless, in the face of the history of old periods, these ten years of the Republic are a monument of unprecedented revival and dazzling leap forward!...

title: Signing of the 'Balkan Entente' between Turkey, Greece, Yugoslavia and Romania.
Adoption of the Surname Law.
Mustafa Kemal's opening speech for the fourth meeting year of the fourth period of the Turkish Grand National Assembly:
description: ... I know how you want the nation's youth to be advanced in all fine arts. This is being done. However, the most urgent thing to be carried forward in this is Turkish music. The measure of a nation's new change is its ability to receive and grasp change in music...

title: Adoption of the Law granting Mustafa Kemal the surname 'ATATÜRK' in the Turkish Grand National Assembly.
Adoption of the Law on the abolition of nicknames and titles such as Efendi, Bey, Pasha, Hazretleri, etc.
Adoption of the Constitutional amendment granting Turkish women the right to elect and be elected as deputies.
ATATÜRK's fourth election as President.
Acceptance of ATATÜRK's naming of Hilal-i Ahmer as 'Kızılay' (The Turkish Red Crescent) at the Kızılay Congress.
ATATÜRK's speech at the ceremony held at Etimesgut Airport for the opening of Türkkuşu to service:
description: ... Turkish child! As in every work, in aviation too, at the highest level, you will soon fill your place waiting for you in the sky!...

title: ATATÜRK's opening speech at the Fourth Great Congress of the Republican People's Party:
description: A ruined country on the edge of a cliff... Bloody struggles with various enemies... Years of war... After that, a new homeland, new society, new state recognized with respect at home and abroad, and continuous revolutions to achieve these... Here is a brief expression of the Turkish General Revolution!

title: ATATÜRK's opening speech for the first meeting year of the fifth period of the Turkish Grand National Assembly:
description: ... Events remind the Turkish nation of two important rules again: To be strong enough to defend our homeland and our rights! To give importance to international cooperation that will preserve peace! ...

title: ATATÜRK's attendance at the opening ceremony of the 'Faculty of Languages, History and Geography' in Ankara.
Signing of the 'Montreux Convention' which enabled the Straits to pass under Turkish Government sovereignty.
ATATÜRK's opening speech for the second meeting year of the fifth period of the Turkish Grand National Assembly:
description: ... The Republic, as much as it has put the Turkish nation on a safe and secure path to the future with its new and solid foundations, has become the herald of a completely new life in terms of the security it has created in ideas and spirits...

title: Acceptance of Hatay's independence at the League of Nations meeting in Geneva.
ATATÜRK's telegram announcing that he donated all his farms and property to the Treasury.
Signing of the Saadabad Pact between Turkey, Iran, Iraq and Afghanistan.
ATATÜRK's opening speech for the third meeting year of the fifth period of the Turkish Grand National Assembly:
description: ... I am pleased to declare before you that there is no room for thinking that any obstacle could prevent our nation from reaching the high level of civilisation and prosperity it deserves, and that there will be no room for such thinking!...

title: Publication of the first official bulletin about ATATÜRK's illness by the General Secretariat of the Presidency after Prof. Dr. Fissenger, invited from France, examined ATATÜRK.
description: (This report states that Fissenger's examination found no cause for concern regarding Atatürk's health and that a recommendation for approximately one and a half months of rest was deemed sufficient.)

title: ATATÜRK's arrival from Ankara to İstanbul. (He remained in İstanbul until his death.)
ATATÜRK's writing of his will at Dolmabahçe Palace. (The will was delivered by ATATÜRK to the Sixth Notary of İstanbul who was called to Dolmabahçe Palace on September 6, 1938.)
ATATÜRK's first severe coma.
ATATÜRK's message to the Army of the Republic of Turkey on the occasion of the 15th Anniversary of the Republic:
description: ... I and our great nation have complete faith and confidence that you are ready at all times to perform your duty, which consists of protecting the honor and dignity of the Turkish homeland and the Turkish community against all kinds of internal and external dangers...

title: Reading of ATATÜRK's opening speech for the fourth meeting year of the fifth period of the Turkish Grand National Assembly by Prime Minister Celâl Bayar:
description: ... To strengthen our country more every day, to keep it in a state that can resist all kinds of possibilities in every field, and to follow all phases of world events with great vigilance, is the beginning of the principles on which our peace-loving policy will be based!...

title: ATATÜRK's second severe coma.
ATATÜRK's death at Dolmabahçe Palace at five minutes past nine.
Opening of ATATÜRK's will by the Third Civil Court of Peace of Ankara.
